intro: Heracleum mandenovae, commonly known as the Siberian cowparn. It is a tall perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, including parts of Russia and Kazakhstan. The plant is characterized by its large, compound leaves that can reach up to 1 meter in length, and it produces clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers in late summer. Heracleum mandenovae is part of the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and some toxic species. It is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats and can grow up to 3 meters in height.
